title: Public opinion polls influence voting decisions

content.question: Public opinion polls are a way to link the public with elected officials. Members of Congress often use polls to understand the views of their constituents, but they must also pay attention to other political considerations.Identify two characteristics of a valid, scientific, public opinion poll.Explain why each of the following enhances the influence of public opinion on the voting decisions of members of Congress.Strong public opinion as expressed in polling resultsCompetitive re-electionsExplain why each of the following limits the influence of public opinion on the voting decisions of members of Congress.Legislators' voting recordsParty leadership
